de.esoco.lib.manage

Class Transaction

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.lib.manage.Transaction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Transactional

    public class Transaction
extends java.lang.Object
implements Transactional
    A transaction class. Transaction instances are typically managed on a per-thread basis by the TransactionManager class unless they are created through TransactionManager.beginUnmanagedTransaction().

    A transaction basically is a queue of Transactional elements which can be committed or rolled back together with the methods in this class. The queue structure means that the elements that have been added first will also be processed first when the transaction is finished (the FIFO principle).

    If a transaction element implements the Releasable interface it will be automatically released when a transaction is finished in either way. The number of calls to the Releasable.release()method will be equal to the number of times the element has been added to the transaction with the addElement(Transactional) method. Applications therefore do not need to release such elements by themselves after handing them over to the transaction manager.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addElement(Transactional rElement)
      Adds a certain transactional element to this transaction.
      void commit()
      Performs a commit by invoking Transactional.commit() on all elements of this transaction if the topmost transaction level has been reached.
      java.util.Collection<Transactional> getElements()
      Returns a readonly collection of the transactional elements in this transaction.
      int getLevel()
      Returns the current transaction level.
      boolean isFinished()
      Checks whether this transaction has been finished completely.
      void removeElement(Transactional rElement)
      Removes a certain element from the this transaction.
      void rollback()
      Performs a rollback by invoking Transactional.rollback() on all elements of this transaction.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this transaction.

    • Method Detail

      • addElement

        public final void addElement(Transactional rElement)
        Adds a certain transactional element to this transaction. If the element is already part of this transaction it will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        rElement - The element to add
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If this transaction is no longer active

      • commit

        public final void commit()
                  throws TransactionException
        Performs a commit by invoking Transactional.commit() on all elements of this transaction if the topmost transaction level has been reached.
        Specified by:
        commit in interface Transactional
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If this transaction is no longer active
        TransactionException - If the rollback of a certain transaction element fails

      • getElements

        public final java.util.Collection<Transactional> getElements()
        Returns a readonly collection of the transactional elements in this transaction. The returned collection will contain all transaction elements that have been added to this transaction so far. If this transaction is new or inactive (see hasActiveElements()) the returned list will be empty.
        Returns:
        The list of transaction elements

      • getLevel

        public final int getLevel()
        Returns the current transaction level. The starting level of a transaction is 1. A level of zero means that the transaction has been committed or rolled back.
        Returns:
        The current transaction level

      • isFinished

        public final boolean isFinished()
        Checks whether this transaction has been finished completely.
        Returns:
        TRUE if this transaction has been finished

      • removeElement

        public final void removeElement(Transactional rElement)
        Removes a certain element from the this transaction. If the element isn't currently part of this transaction the method call won't have any effect. The given element will neither be committed nor rolled back by this method. It is the responsibility of the calling context to handle the removed element as necessary.
        Parameters:
        rElement - The element to remove from the thread's current transaction
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If this transaction is no longer active

      • rollback

        public final void rollback()
                    throws TransactionException
        Performs a rollback by invoking Transactional.rollback() on all elements of this transaction.
        Specified by:
        rollback in interface Transactional
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If this transaction is no longer active
        TransactionException - If the rollback of a certain transaction element fails

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this transaction.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A string describing this transaction
